docs.abstract: With the prepaid cards, parents don’t need to have cash on hand. Promoters say the cards give parents digital oversight of their children’s spending.
docs.snippet: With the prepaid cards, parents don’t need to have cash on hand. Promoters say the cards give parents digital oversight of their children’s spending.
docs.lead_paragraph: No need to worry about coming up with cash for a child’s allowance. Parents can now choose from a rapidly expanding menu of prepaid debit cards, aimed at giving them digital oversight of their children’s spending and saving habits.

headline.main: Children’s Allowances in a New Form: Debit Cards Linked to Parents’ Phones
headline.print_headline: Dishes Done? Leaves Raked? Here’s a Paperless Allowance

docs.abstract: Readers weigh in on the company’s minimum-pay increase.
docs.snippet: Readers weigh in on the company’s minimum-pay increase.

docs.abstract: A breakup of the web grants privacy, security and freedom to some, and not so much to others.
docs.snippet: A breakup of the web grants privacy, security and freedom to some, and not so much to others.
docs.lead_paragraph: In September, Eric Schmidt, the former Google chief executive and Alphabet chairman, said that in the next 10 to 15 years, the internet would most likely be split in two — one internet led by China and one internet led by the United States.

headline.main: There May Soon Be Three Internets. America’s Won’t Necessarily Be the Best.
headline.print_headline: As Internet Splinters, the World Suffers

docs.abstract: He has promised money for schools. There are several grass-roots efforts to spread the Montessori method that could really use some.
docs.snippet: He has promised money for schools. There are several grass-roots efforts to spread the Montessori method that could really use some.
docs.lead_paragraph: Jeff Bezos, the founder of Amazon and the owner of The Washington Post, surprised the education world when he announced this month that he was donating $2 billion to support homeless families and create a network of free Montessori-inspired preschools.

headline.main: Jeff Bezos and the Trap of the Charitable-Industrial Complex

docs.abstract: Technology chief executives were once admired for their force-of-nature personalities and daring. Now boring is the new black (or is it beige?). Except for Elon Musk, of course.
docs.snippet: Technology chief executives were once admired for their force-of-nature personalities and daring. Now boring is the new black (or is it beige?). Except for Elon Musk, of course.
docs.lead_paragraph: When Joe Barton, a Republican congressman from Texas, greeted Jack Dorsey at a congressional hearing last week, he sounded flummoxed.

headline.main: The Metamorphosis of Silicon Valley C.E.O.s: From Big to Boring

docs.abstract: Tech workers are pushing back against federal contracts, particularly with the Pentagon. Here’s why that might be a mistake.
docs.snippet: Tech workers are pushing back against federal contracts, particularly with the Pentagon. Here’s why that might be a mistake.
docs.lead_paragraph: Alex Karp grew up in a liberal household and considers himself a progressive. He voted for Hillary Clinton, and he lives and works in Silicon Valley.

headline.main: Silicon Valley Doesn’t Like Trump. It Can Still Work With the Government.
headline.print_headline: Why Tech’s Split With Trump Could Set the Country Back

keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces

docs.abstract: Sales are booming at major chains that have taken cues from their giant online rival — signs of a revival in a $3.5 trillion industry.
docs.snippet: Sales are booming at major chains that have taken cues from their giant online rival — signs of a revival in a $3.5 trillion industry.
docs.lead_paragraph: Malls are being hollowed out. Shops are closing by the thousands. Retailers are going bankrupt.

headline.main: Hard Lessons (Thanks, Amazon) Breathe New Life Into Retail Stores
headline.print_headline: Amazon Model Gives Retailers Path to Vitality

docs.abstract: The actor left the stage soon after playing Lear in 1986. Now 80, he is giving it another go, in a made-for-television film directed by Richard Eyre.
docs.snippet: The actor left the stage soon after playing Lear in 1986. Now 80, he is giving it another go, in a made-for-television film directed by Richard Eyre.
docs.lead_paragraph: SAMPHIRE HOE, England — High above the sea, on the white cliffs of Dover, soldiers hoisted equipment and secured tents in what looked like a military encampment. A man appeared at the edge of a tent, his white hair close-cropped, his grizzled face shadowed by a ragged beard. “Shall we get on with it?” Anthony Hopkins said.

headline.main: Anthony Hopkins Returns to ‘King Lear,’ Finally Up to the Challenge
headline.print_headline: Finally Ready to Take On ‘King Lear’

docs.abstract: With Facebook, Google and Amazon dominating India’s internet, lawmakers have declared their intention to impose tough new rules on the tech industry.
docs.snippet: With Facebook, Google and Amazon dominating India’s internet, lawmakers have declared their intention to impose tough new rules on the tech industry.
docs.lead_paragraph: NEW DELHI — In India, American companies dominate the internet. Facebook’s WhatsApp is the most popular app on phones. Virtually every smartphone runs on Google’s Android system. YouTube is the favorite video platform and Amazon is the No. 2 online retailer.

headline.main: India Pushes Back Against Tech ‘Colonization’ by Internet Giants
headline.print_headline: India’s Regulators Seek to Rein In Internet Giants

docs.abstract: A hit podcast is reimagined with creepy sets, unsettling visuals — and Julia Roberts.
docs.snippet: A hit podcast is reimagined with creepy sets, unsettling visuals — and Julia Roberts.
docs.lead_paragraph: UNIVERSAL CITY, Calif. — What do you see? If you’re listening to “Homecoming,” the cult hit podcast from Gimlet Media, the answer is nothing. A psychological thriller set largely inside a mysterious corporate facility somewhere in Florida, the podcast’s story is relayed strictly through sound, even more so than other fictional podcasts of late, or the cliffhanger-loving radio dramas that preceded them. Seemingly cobbled together from found recordings of phone calls and therapy sessions, there’s not even a narrator to tell you where you are, or when.

headline.main: In ‘Homecoming,’ a Sound Experiment Becomes Something to See
headline.print_headline: ‘Homecoming,’ Now Seen as Well as Heard
